prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** *Shape*: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The model is centered and has a uniform gray color. *Dimensions*: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.0107 units *Instructions*: Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system calibrated to the global coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Face 1 (Base) Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane (parallel to the base plane) using the following guidelines: 1. Line 1: Create a line from the origin (0.0, 0.0) to the point (0.75, 0.0). 2. Line 2: Create a line from the point (0.75, 0.0) to the point (0.75, 0.75). 3. Line 3: Create a line from the point (0.75, 0.75) to the point (0.0, 0.75). 4. Line 4: Create a line from the point (0.0, 0.75) to the origin (0.0, 0.0) to close the loop. Extrusion Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch and then extrude the shape in the Z-direction to generate the 3D model with the following scaling and extrusion parameters: - `Sketch Scale`: 0.75 - `Extrusion Depth Towards Normal`: 0.0107 - `Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal`: 0.0 Operations Combine the geometry with existing bodies or remove material from them, if necessary, using appropriate boolean operations: - *New Body Feature*: Add this geometry as a new solid body when there are no existing bodies to combine it with. - *Combine Feature*: Use this operation to join the new geometry with the existing body when there is overlap between the new and existing geometries. - *Cut Feature*: Use this operation to subtract the new geometry from the existing body when the new geometry exists exclusively within the confines of the existing body. Remember to apply the appropriate boolean operations in order to ensure that the new geometry interacts with the existing bodies as required.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating a Rectangular Prism Begin by creating a new coordinate system for the rectangular prism. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Next, create a sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. The sketch should contain a single loop with 4 lines. * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1364] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.1364], End Point [0.0, 0.1364] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1364], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This will create a rectangle with a width of 0.75 units and a height of 0.1364 units. The length of the rectangle is not specified, so it can be any length. Finally, extrude the sketch by 0.3409 units along the normal direction. This will create a 3D solid with the dimensions 2 units by 4 units by 6 units (2 units in length, 4 units in width, and 6 units in height). Part 2: Creating a Cylindrical Hole Create a new coordinate system for the cylindrical hole. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0477, 0.0273, 0.3409]. Next, create a sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. The sketch should contain a single loop with a circle. * Circle 1: Center [0.0409, 0.0409], Radius 0.0409 Create another sketch on face 2 of the coordinate system. The sketch should also contain a single loop with a circle. * Circle 1: Center [0.6136, 0.0409], Radius 0.0409 These circles will create a cylindrical hole in the rectangular prism. The height of the cylindrical hole is not specified, but it will be 0.3409 units deep. Finally, use a cut operation to remove the cylindrical hole from the rectangular prism. This will create the final shape, which is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole on one side. The height of the final shape is 0.3409 units, the width is 0.6545 units, and the length can be any length.</description>
